metadata.feature_description: Configures multi-threaded crawling for improved performance.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Scheduler Panel and View Global Thread Settings

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Scheduler in the Persona Bar
steps.expected: Scheduler panel should load and display global thread configuration
steps.actual: Scheduler panel loaded successfully showing: Max Threads: 1, Active Threads: 0, Free Threads: 1, Scheduler Mode: Timer Method

steps.action: View SCHEDULER tab to see all scheduled tasks
steps.expected: List of scheduled tasks should be displayed including SearchCrawler tasks
steps.actual: SCHEDULER tab displayed all scheduled tasks including 'Search: Site Crawler', 'Search: File Crawler', and 'Search: Url Crawler'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access Search: Url Crawler Task Settings

steps.action: Click Edit Task button for 'Search: Url Crawler' task
steps.expected: Task settings panel should expand showing configuration options
steps.actual: Task settings expanded showing: Friendly Name, Full Class Name, Retain Schedule History, Servers, Object Dependencies, Frequency (2 Days), Retry Time Lapse (30 Minutes), Run on Event, Catch Up Tasks, Enable Schedule toggle

steps.action: Verify task configuration is accessible and editable
steps.expected: All settings should be viewable with appropriate controls
steps.actual: All task settings are accessible including: Delete, Cancel, Run Now, and Update buttons. Full Class Name shows: DotNetNuke.Professional.SearchCrawler.SearchSpider.SearchSpider

steps.action: Click edit icon next to Scheduler Mode to access threading configuration
steps.expected: Should be able to configure thread count for the scheduler or per-task threading
steps.actual: Scheduler Mode edit dialog showed only: Scheduler Mode dropdown (Disabled/Timer Method/Request Method) and Schedule Delay field. No option to edit Max Threads or per-task IndexThreads configuration was found in the UI

issues: No UI element found to configure global Max Threads setting
No UI element found to configure per-task IndexThreads for SearchCrawler
Code analysis shows IndexThreads parameter exists (Spider.cs:342-361, SearchSpiderHelper.cs:588) with default value of 1, but no corresponding UI configuration

observations: Code suggests multi-threading support exists: Spider.cs creates multiple DocumentWorker instances based on 'threads' parameter (lines 352-361)
IndexThreads setting is stored in ScheduleHistoryItemSettings with default value 1 (SearchSpiderHelper.cs:588)
Global scheduler displays Max Threads: 1 as read-only value - no UI control to modify it
Multi-threading configuration may require database-level changes or config file modifications rather than UI configuration
The Scheduler panel displays thread status (Max/Active/Free Threads) but does not provide controls to change Max Threads
